author: mini_mads1980
title: Not Bad, But Not Great Either
review:
Overview

Police Officer Harry arrived on the front of Issue 35 of the Lego City Comic.  Priced at £4.25 in the UK it was available in early 2021 - no dates were on the comic.  Harry comes with a small helicopter build.

Packet

Once again the Lego that you get with the comic comes in a silver foil bag that measures approximately 120x150mm, and is attached to the front of the comic by sticky tape.  This limited edition set contains 31 pieces and front image gives us a close up image of Harry piloting the helicopter up in the Lego City skies.

The back of the packet is mostly the standard safety information and copyrights.  There is 1:1 image of the Transparent Bright Red Round 1x1 Plate that can just be seen behind Harry in the image on the front on the port side of the aircraft.

Minifigure

Harry is a basic police Minifigure.  He is wearing a white helmet with visor and has the aviator glasses that Lego like to use for pilots.  His torso is one that Lego have used since 2017, but is still in use for the 2021 police sets, so fits the theme well.  However it is not usually an aviation torso, so this makes the Minifigure unique to the set.  The front of the torso has Harry wearing a tie, that might not be such a great idea in a helicopter with an open cockpit!  It also sports a radio on the belt and on the rear there is the word Police.

His legs are not printed, but the Earth Blue looks good and goes well with the torso.  You do not get any accessories to go with Harry, so if he does apprehend a criminal he will have to hold them until back-up arrives.

Harry is made up of the following:

  • Helmet - White Mini Crash Helmet [4298609]
  • Visor - Transparent Brown Mini Visor 2 [6244785]
  • Head - Bright Yellow Mini Head No. 1663 [6112622]
  • Torso - Light Royal Blue Mini Upper Part 3627 [6172536]
  • Legs - Earth Blue Mini Lower Part [4162916]

It is the eleventh time we have had a police themed set on the comic in 35 issues.

Main Build/Parts

The build here is a little bit of a let down for me.  The controls don't reach the Minifigure hands, like the small aerial's genrally do on these types of builds, and although I know they are limited with part numbers the central part of the helicopter is basically a 2x2 column with the odd bit protruding.  The whole thing sits on a 2x6 plate, with no feet/skids.

Having said that the way the tail is built is nice and they have added a couple of cones using SNOT to give the impression of exhaust ports.  The propellors, which are a bit fragile, do the job and rotate freely after a good push and only fall off if hit too hard.  One of the 1x6 tiles used for the propellors that I had was slightly discoloured, but this is not too noticeable and only minor.

Verdict

I can't say this is my favourite set to be included in the comic line, however it is not the worst.  The build is simple enough with a little SNOT building and one good bit of part usage to attach the tail to the body. However, I do feel that it could have been better with the same number of parts.  Trying to add a little shape to it would have made a huge improvement and controls/something for it to sit on were required.  It feels like something HM Murdock would have thrown together with his mates while stuck in a farm building.

I also think the torso used was wrong and they could have used the Earth Blue ones they normally do for pilots.  This is only a minor issue, as it is a police figure and it does the job.

Up next is a small construction set.
